item_prototype.name: {#DISK} iostat w/s
item_prototype.description: The number (after merges) of write requests completed per second for the device.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK} iostat read
item_prototype.description: The number of sectors megabytes read from the device per second.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK} iostat write
item_prototype.description: The number of sectors megabytes write to device per second.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK} iostat await
item_prototype.description: The average time (in milliseconds) for I/O requests issued to the device to be served. This includes the time spent by the requests in queue and the time spent servicing them.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK} iostat %util
item_prototype.description: Percentage of CPU time during which I/O requests were issued to the device (bandwidth utilization for the device). Device saturation occurs when this value is close to 100% for devices serving requests serially. But for devices serving requests in parallel, such as RAID arrays and modern SSDs, this number does not reflect their performance limits.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK} iostat tps
item_prototype.description: Indicate the number of transfers per second that were issued to the device. A transfer is an I/O request to the device. Multiple logical requests can be combined into a single I/O request to the device. A transfer is of indeterminate size.
